meanings.definition: The long, thin piece of wood on a guitar or other stringed instrument where the player presses down to change the pitch of the strings.
meanings.sent1: The guitarist slid his fingers along the fretboards to play different notes.
meanings.sent2: She practiced diligently to master the fretboards on her new guitar.
meanings.sent3: The fretboards on the guitar were like a musical puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced effortlessly on the fretboards, creating beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent5: The smooth fretboards felt like a pathway to musical exploration.

meanings.definition: The fretted part of a stringed instrument where the player presses down to produce different notes.
meanings.sent1: The violinist's fingers moved swiftly on the fretboards to hit the right notes.
meanings.sent2: The musician carefully cleaned the fretboards of his mandolin after each performance.
meanings.sent3: The fretboards on the ukulele seemed to whisper secrets to the player.
meanings.sent4: Her heart raced as she explored the fretboards of the new banjo.
meanings.sent5: The fretboards gleamed under the stage lights, inviting the guitarist's touch.
